intro: Polygala insipida, commonly known as the insipid milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Polygalaceae family, which includes approximately 1,500 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as plains and rocky soils, and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its flowers are small and usually white or pale green, and it produces small, winged fruits known as follicles. Polygala insipida is often found in open habitats and is considered a characteristic species of the Chihuahuan Desert.
